item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Ceasefire in Gaza chances shrinking, Qatar says
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu says "the war is in full swing" and calls on Hamas fighters to surrender.

item.title: Elite Afghan troops face return to Taliban after UK 'betrayal'
item.description: About 200 British-trained special forces soldiers are in danger as Pakistan expels undocumented foreigners.

item.title: Zelensky faces key tests to re-energise West's support for Ukraine
item.description: A White House visit is on the Ukrainian leader's agenda as cracks appear among Western allies.

item.title: Mosquito-borne disease risk looms for UK - study
item.description: Diseases like dengue fever could be common if little is done to tackle climate change, report warns.

item.title: Peter Kay plays secret homecoming shows to raise funds for Bolton Octagon theatre
item.description: The comedian breaks off from his arena tour to perform three intimate fundraising shows in one day.

item.title: Street drugs stronger than heroin linked to 54 deaths in UK
item.description: Synthetic opioids are being produced in illicit labs in China, the UK's National Crime Agency says.

item.title: 'The law needs to catch up on student mental health'
item.description: A High Court is looking at whether universities owe a duty of care towards their students.

item.title: Veterans demand Commons debate on review into past armed forces gay ban
item.description: Campaigners are accusing the government of failing on its key pledges over LGBT veterans ban.

item.title: Australian swimmers approach whale 'dangerously close' to shore
item.description: The whale strayed into shallow waters, which caught the attention of swimmers.

item.title: Javier Milei: New president tells Argentina 'shock treatment' looms
item.description: The country's new far-right president vows to launch a radical economic programme as he is sworn in.

item.title: Man arrested in connection with 1984 murder
item.description: Anthony Littler, 45, was found with with head injuries in an alleyway near a London Tube station.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity winner named after Sam Thompson, Tony Bellew and Nigel Farage made final
item.description: Sam Thompson, Tony Bellew and Nigel Farage were the last men standing on the reality TV show.

item.title: The Papers: Sunak 'fights for his future' ahead of Rwanda vote
item.description: The PM could face threats to his leadership if MPs oppose his migration plans, several of Monday's front pages predict.

item.title: Covid inquiry: What was the impact of Eat Out to Help Out?
item.description: How much did the scheme help the economy and affect the spread of Covid?

item.title: New Zealand smoking ban: Māori mourn loss of hard-won smoking reform
item.description: The model for an end to tobacco had been pushed for decades by New Zealand's Indigenous people.

item.title: How chocolate became the winter beverage of choice
item.description: The ceremony of supping hot chocolate has been a tradition in the capital since the 17th Century.

item.title: Why Wagner is winning hearts in the Central African Republic
item.description: The BBC visits the Central African Republic to see why Russian Wagner forces are so popular there.

item.title: Bryan Adams reveals Diana song lyrics sparked 'surreal' friendship
item.description: A B-side from the Canadian urged a supposedly fictional Diana to leave her husband and "bring her limousine".

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6: Car-top twerking, flamingos in a crazy Miami
item.description: The Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer depicts the city's extremes - what does it tell us about US culture?

item.title: Tate McRae: Singer says she feels 'way more badass' after ditching 'sad girl' persona
item.description: The Canadian singer on her transformation from Billie Eilish balladeer to platinum-plated pop star.

item.title: Poland's popcorn moment as pro-EU leader Tusk returns to power
item.description: Judges, journalists and women's groups watch as Poland's Donald Tusk inches closer to power.

item.title: How the war changed Russia’s climate agenda
item.description: Never an enthusiastic participant in green initiatives, Russia, Europe's energy powerhouse, has pushed climate change further down its list of priorities following the invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Ohtani: How 'Shotime' became Japan's biggest baseball export
item.description: He's made more impact than every Japanese player before him - and has now signed a record $700m deal.

item.title: Why do people always wait until January to get fit?
item.description: Many people wait until the new year to join a gym or start running - but now might be the best time.

item.title: No more 'Candy girls': Powerful women break Korean drama barriers
item.description: Korean dramas now have female leads, after years when the spotlight rarely shone on women.

item.title: Fossil fuels: Can humanity really kick its addiction?
item.description: Will the transition to a new clean energy system happen quickly, or will we fry the planet first?

item.title: Five climate change solutions under the spotlight at COP28
item.description: The world is well off track to limit warming to 1.5C, but there have been some encouraging steps.

item.title: Egypt election: Discontent grows as Sisi seeks third term
item.description: Many people are disgruntled with the president's handling of the economy after a decade in power.

item.title: Teenage children of jailed Narges Mohammadi accept her Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: In a speech smuggled from prison and read out by her twins, Narges Mohammadi denounces "tyrannical" Iran.

item.title: Homeless boy fears Santa will not find him at Christmas
item.description: Eight-year-old Marcel and his mum are one of many families facing Christmas living in a hotel room.

item.title: McDonald's security guard soaks homeless man's sleeping bag
item.description: The worker is seen kicking the homeless man's belongings away as he tries to mop the street.

item.title: Sudan war: Two people killed in attack on aid convoy in Sudan, says Red Cross
item.description: Seven others including three charity staff were injured in what the Red Cross has called a "deliberate attack".

item.title: Pliosaur discovery: Huge sea monster emerges from Dorset cliffs
item.description: Scientists marvel at the fossilised head of an underwater 'killing machine' from the Jurassic.

item.title: 'Quick and nasty' tornado causes destruction in Irish village
item.description: While the tornado caused a lot of damage, it is not thought that anyone is badly hurt.

item.title: Iron Age: How Wales was ruled from hillforts pre-Romans
item.description: Iron Age leaders ruled from fortified villages on 700 hilltops across Wales, an archaeologist says.

item.title: Tory peer Michelle Mone 'regrets' denying links with PPE firm
item.description: PPE Medpro is being sued by the government and is being investigated by the National Crime Agency (NCA).

item.title: Smile Direct Club dentistry aligners firm shuts down
item.description: Best known for selling clear aligners remotely, it has shut down months after filing for bankruptcy.

item.title: Spanish La Liga match abandoned after fan dies in stands
item.description: Granada's La Liga match against Athletic Bilbao will be completed on Monday after a supporter dies in the stands at Nuevo Los Carmenes stadium.

item.title: Coral reef: How divers are using antibiotics to save sick corals
item.description: Turks and Caicos Islanders are helping protect the reef from the deadliest ever coral sickness.

item.title: Alex Jones: Conspiracy theorist returns to X with Andrew Tate repost
item.description: The conspiracy theorist was banned from Twitter - now X - but its owner has now reinstated him.

item.title: Aleksandar Vucic: The man who remade Serbia
item.description: Aleksandar Vucic has dominated Serbian politics but rivals see elections as a first step in removing him.

item.title: Doncaster couple bring 'joy and cheer' with Wonka décor
item.description: Michael and Paul Fenning say their home is "keeping Christmas magic alive".

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of autumn colours
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Royal Family members reveal family Christmas card images
item.description: Prince and Princess of Wales use a monochrome image, while King and Queen go for Coronation photo.

item.title: Shirley Ballas says bullying nearly forced her to quit
item.description: The Strictly Come Dancing judge says she was targeted by men "at the top" of dancing.

item.title: Elizabeth Magill: UPenn president quits in antisemitism row
item.description: She has faced mounting calls to resign since giving controversial Congressional testimony.

item.title: Shropshire: Two die after crash involving police vehicle
item.description: A man in his 60s and a woman in her 50s died and an officer is in hospital after the collision.

item.title: Stephen Fry back at work three months after fall off stage
item.description: The actor speaks for the first time about needing a cane to walk after falling 6ft (1.8m) at the O2 Arena.

item.title: Northern Lights award won by stunning shot taken in Wales
item.description: He went to Iceland for the Northern Lights - but took his outstanding photo 10 minutes from home.

item.title: Mahsa Amini's family stopped at airport on way to get award
item.description: Iran bans her parents from heading to Europe to collect an award in her honour, their lawyer says.

item.title: 'Oh, he does smell good!': BBC presenter sniffs therapy husky dog
item.description: Charlie Stayt gets up close with Thunder the therapy dog as he visits BBC Breakfast.

item.title: MOTD2 analysis: ‘They will still win the league’ – is Man City’s ‘mini-crisis’ over?
item.description: Manchester City returned to winning ways against Luton on Sunday, but are last year's Treble-winners in the right shape to mount another title bid?

item.title: India v England: Tourists miss chance to seal series clean sweep
item.description: England miss the chance to record a series clean sweep over India after falling to a five-wicket defeat in the third and final T20 in Mumbai.

item.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Alisson, McGinn, Silva, Salah, Son
item.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?

item.title: Chris Billam-Smith beats Mateusz Masternak to defend WBO cruiserweight title
item.description: Britain's Chris Billam-Smith defends his WBO cruiserweight title as Mateusz Masternak retires in the eighth round in Bournemouth.

item.title: Tottenham 4-1 Newcastle: How Richarlison revived Spurs
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Shay Given and Micah Richards analyse how Richarlison helped revive Tottenham in their 4-1 Premier League win over Newcastle.

item.title: Newcastle running on fumes, while Tottenham hope they're back on track after 4-1 win
item.description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe has dealt expertly with all challenges placed in front of him since arriving, but is now facing his biggest at the worst possible time.

item.title: Racing 92 28-31 Harlequins: Marcus Smith steers Quins to superb Investec Champions Cup win in Paris
item.description: Harlequins fight back to beat Top 14 league leaders Racing 92 in a thrilling Investec Champions Cup match in Paris.

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: Video shows Gaza detainees allegedly 'surrendering guns' - what we know
item.description: A man in his underwear is filmed laying down weapons - but there are questions about what happened.

item.title: Israel-Gaza: The status quo is smashed. The future is messy and dangerous
item.description: Even when the war between Israel and Hamas ends, there is no easy future, the BBC's Jeremy Bowen says.

item.title: Al-Mawasi: Gaza humanitarian zone not humane, evacuees say
item.description: Israel has told civilians to shelter in a "safe" zone, but people say it is not fit for people to stay in.

item.title: The Israeli woman still helping sick Palestinians
item.description: Volunteers used to drive sick Gazans to hospital. Hamas's attack on 7 October changed everything.

item.title: Hamas hostages: Stories of the people taken from Israel
item.description: It is thought more than 100 Israelis are still being held hostage in Gaza after the 7 October attacks.

item.title: Hamas claims Israeli operation ended in hostage death
item.description: The group releases video it says shows the aftermath of a failed attempt to free a hostage held in Gaza.

item.title: Palestinian recounts being stripped and driven away by Israeli army
item.description: The BBC speaks to one of the men seen being detained, who was later released.

item.title: Images show major damage to Gaza's oldest mosque
item.description: Hamas accuses Israel of causing the damage to the medieval Omari mosque, Israel has not yet commented.

item.title: Palestinians mourn writer killed in air strike
item.description: Writer and literary scholar Refaat Alareer was killed in an air strike on Wednesday, his family say.

item.title: Israel war cabinet minister's son killed in Gaza fighting
item.description: Gadi Eisenkot's son Gal, 25, died after a tunnel shaft exploded in northern Gaza, Israeli media say.

item.title: Gaza Strip in maps: How life has changed in two months
item.description: Find out how much has changed in the Gaza Strip since Israel began its military response to Hamas's attacks on 7 October.

item.title: Hundreds queue for food in central Gaza city
item.description: As hunger spreads, the UN says it can no longer run a dependable humanitarian operation.

item.title: Video shows stripped Palestinian men detained in Gaza
item.description: Pictures on social media show dozens of men in their underwear being guarded by Israeli troops in north Gaza.

item.title: Bringing Nova festival attack survivors back from darkness
item.description: "I just wanted them to be held": Inside the centre helping survivors of the 7 October attacks.

item.title: 'I'm helpless' - Gaza doctor tells of desperate situation
item.description: Dr Ahmed Moghrabi told the BBC there's a scarcity of food, water, medicine and he cannot operate on patients.

item.title: Israel hostages in Gaza: We have evidence their health worsening, say families
item.description: A three-hour meeting between freed hostages and Israel's leaders turned tense, observers say.

item.title: Israeli settler violence brings destruction and fear to West Bank as war rages
item.description: Attacks including fatal shootings of Palestinians by Jewish settlers have risen sharply since 7 October.

item.title: Six tips for getting a job if you're over 50
item.description: Recruiters and charities give their advice for anyone wanting to get back into work.

item.title: Buy now, pay later: Things you need to know about the loan schemes
item.description: With the winter sales season in full swing here's what you need to know before borrowing money.

item.title: Energy saving tips: Five ways to cut costs this winter
item.description: Energy prices will be lower this winter than last - but you may be able to save even more on your bill.

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: How to save money even when the budget is tight
item.description: The interest paid on savings is better than anything seen for years, so how can you save when bills are rising?
